details.title: TN records single day high of 2,396 cases
details.content: Tamil Nadu reported a record single-day spike of 2,396 fresh COVID-19 cases on Saturday, recording over 2,000 infections for a fourth straight day as the overall tally rose to 56,845 in the state, the Health department said. Also, 38 people succumbed to the virus, taking the toll in the state to 704.

details.title: CISF jawan succumbs to COVID-19; 18th death among paramilitary forces
details.content: Officials said constable Jitender Kumar died at the RML Hospital here after he was admitted with fever and difficulty in breathing on June 10. The jawan had contracted the coronavirus infection and was deployed for law and order duties in Delhi, a senior CISF officer said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19: Team of doctors from different hospitals on standby for Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain
details.content: Jain was on Saturday administered plasma therapy at the Max Hospital in Saket and his condition is stable now, sources said. A team of doctors from a few government and private hospitals has been kept on standby to assist the doctors attending to him, if needed, sources said (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Keep animal shelters and pet shops open, welfare board urges govt
details.content: As Tamil Nadu government is enforcing a stringent lockdown in Chennai and three other neighboring districts, the state animal welfare board on Sunday has appealed to the authorities concerned to allow animal shelters and pet shops to remain operational. (READ MORE)

details.title: Create isolation wards, conduct rapid tests to curb spread of COVID-19 in jails
details.content: With several inmates and staff at prisons in the city testing positive for COVID-19, a high-powered committee headed by a Delhi High Court judge has issued several directions, like creating isolation wards and carrying out rapid tests, to prevent further spread of the virus among prisoners. (READ MORE)

details.title: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's condition improves
details.content: The health condition of Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain has improved after being administered plasma therapy. His fever has subsided and oxygen level has improved. Doctors say that he can be shifted to the general ward by tomorrow: Office of Delhi Health Minister.

details.title: Guru Purnima fair in Mathura cancelled due to coronavirus
details.content: For the first time in over 400 years, Mathura's famous Guru Purnima fair, also known as Mudia Mela, has been cancelled due to the coronavirus pandemic. All shrines in the district, besides Sri Krishna Janamasthan temple, will remain shut for the public till July 8.

details.title: Chennai comes to a standstill on first 'Sunday shutdown'
details.content: It was a virtual curfew with deserted roads, bridges and intersections fully blocked by police using barricades and with the exception of police, sanitary workers and health personnel of the greater Chennai Corporation (GCC) most of others stayed indoors.

details.title: Home Minister Amit Shah to hold meeting in Delhi
details.content: Home Minister Amit Shah will hold a meeting over COVID-19 management in Delhi. Lt Governor Anil Baijal, CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will attend the meeting via video conferencing.

details.title: Change in Delhi action plan
details.content: Mapping of containment zones in Delhi will be done again; close watch on activities inside such areas. Contact tracing will be done for all COVID-19 positive cases in Delhi with help of Aarogya Setu app.

details.title: More on lastest Delhi containment strategy
details.content: Major points of containment Strategy set by Dr Paul are: Renewed delimitation of Containment Zones, strict monitoring & control over the limits & activities within them, Contact Tracing of all infected persons&Quarantining of Contacts, including use of Arogya Setu App.

details.title: More details on the new Delhi strategy
details.content: Each house outside containment zones should be listed and monitored,through which Delhi can get complete information and COVID positive cases to be kept in a hospital, COVID Care Center or Home isolation.COVID Care Centers to be run properly with the help of voluntary organizations/NGOs.

details.title: Serological Survey in Delhi between 27 June and 10 July
details.content: It's been decided that a Serological Survey will be conducted between 27 June and 10 July across Delhi and samples of 20,000 people will be tested. Through this, an overall assessment of COVID infection will be done and a comprehensive strategy will be decided based on findings of the survey.

details.title: Delhi's COVID-19 tally nears 60,000-mark; Authorities start work on robust contact tracing
details.content: Delhi Lt Governor Anil Baijal, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia held a virtual meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah to discuss strategies to make contact tracing more effective and strengthen medical services in COVID-19 affected areas in the city.(READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Researchers find presence of corovavirus in waste water in the country
details.content:
The first wastewater based surveillance in India shows presence of SARS-CoV-2 virus in such water while infectivity or transmission through contaminated water is yet to be identified but researchers say it can help to estimate actual COVID-19 infected population.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Kerala Agriculture minister goes into self quarantine after health worker who was in a meeting with him tests positive
details.content: Agriculture Minister V S Sunilkumar has gone into self-quarantine after he attended a meeting which saw the participation of a health worker who tested positive for the virus. The minister attended the meeting at Thrissur Corporation office on June 15. He quarantined himself at the residence of the minister in Thiruvananthapuram as a precaution. His personal staff were also directed to go into quarantine. Seven people including the health worker have tested positive in Thrissur Corporation.

details.title: COVID-19: Sex workers in Pune seek to resume work with caution, SOPs
details.content: With the lockdown being eased, some sex workers in Pune's red light area want to get back to business by taking all precautions and following the standard operating procedures to stay protected against COVID-19. The livelihood of nearly 3,000 sex workers in the Budhwar Peth area here in Maharashtra has been affected by the COVID-19 outbreak and the subsequent lockdown, following which several of them moved back to their hometowns, according to an NGO working for their welfare. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on COVID-19 situation
details.content:
• Today we are fighting two wars against China - one at the border and another against the virus from China. Our 20 brave soldiers did not back down, we also will not retreat and will win both the wars
  • There has been a three times in testing, earlier it was 5,000 tests per day, now it is around 18,000 per day. Now people will not face any issues in getting tested
  • All those under home-isolation will be provided with pulse oximeters to measure your oxygen levels every few hours. Once you are well, you can return it to the govt

details.title: Karnataka CM directs officials to enforce lockdown norms in high-incidence areas

details.title: Karnataka coronavirus update
details.content: We are steadily maintaining a healthy recovery rate of 61.39% and mortality rate remains low at 1.49%. We're continuing to effectively trace contacts of positive case within 24 hours & every inter-state arrival is being quarantined for 14 days: Karnataka Minister for Medical Education

details.title: BMC launches Mission Zero Rapid Action Plan at Shahaji Raje Bhosale Sports Complex in Andheri
details.content:
बृ.म.पा ने अंधेरी येथील शहाजी राजे भोसले क्रीडा संकुल येथे ‘मिशन झिरो' शीघ्र कृती कार्यक्रम सुरू केला आहे.

प्राथमिक तपासणी करण्यासाठी ५० फिरते दवाखाने मुलुंड, भांडुप, अंधेरी, मालाड, बोरिवली, दहिसर आणि कांदिवली भागात २-३ आठवड्यांसाठी सक्रिय असतील.

#NaToCorona pic.twitter.com/YXFPS4UAEc

— माझी Mumbai, आपली BMC (@mybmc) June 22, 2020

details.title: Kamakhya Temple set to reopen on June 30
details.content: Kamakhya Temple in Assam's capital Guwahati set to open for devotees on 30 June. Temple Doloi (head) tells ANI that Ambubachi Mela (scheduled to take place from 22-25 June) will not take place this year, in view of COVID-19 pandemic. Last year 25 lakh people had participated in the mela.

details.title: New COVID-19 cases in Puducherry fall to 17 as fewer samples tested, tally now 383
details.content: Health Minister Malladi Krishna Rao said 229 samples were tested and the remaining are being tested on Monday. Hence it should not be construed that cases have come down.

details.title: Separate instructions from LG Kiran Bedi disrupting COVID-19 fight: Puducherry Health Minister
details.content: For the past 15 days, the Lt Governor has been passing instructions to officials directly after interacting with them in the evening at 7 pm. The CM or ministers had no knowledge about this, he said.

details.title: Ban on online classes: Karnataka HC asks state government to find solution
details.content: A division bench of Chief Justice Abhay Shreeniwas Oka and Justice Nataraj Rangaswamy issued this direction after hearing the public interest litigation petition filed by Anumitha Sharma and several others. The petitioners challenged the ban on online classes from LKG to 5th standard in the state on June 16.

details.title: Around 3000 COVID beds occupied in Chennai
details.content:
Only around 3,000 beds occupied currently out of the 17,500 beds available at the @chennaicorp’s COVID care centres: Commissioner G Prakash.

Corporation to add more beds in Anna University, IIT-Madras, and 4,500 more beds TNHB building in Ambattur. @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) June 22, 2020

details.title: India has one of the lowest cases per lakh population: Health Ministry
details.content: The WHO Situation Report 153 of 21st June, 2020 shows that India has one of the lowest cases per lakh population in spite of its high population density. India’s cases per lakh population are 30.04 while the global average is more than its triple at 114.67. The recovery rate is 55.77% among COVID-19 patients: Ministry of Health

details.title: Uttarakhand coronavirus update
details.content: 57 new COVID-19 positive cases and 11 patients treated as of June 22, 2020. Total number of positive cases here rises to 2401, including 1511 recovered and 27 deaths: Uttrakhand State Control Room COVID-19

details.content:
Rath Yatra: SC willing to modify its order and allow yatra only in puri without public participation, curfew will be imposed in town @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard

details.title: Street vendor tests positive for COVID-19 in Gwalior, contact tracing begins
details.content: A 28-year-old street vendor was detected with novel coronavirus infection in Gwalior in Madhya Pradesh and the district administration on Monday asked people who may have come in contact with him to come forward to get themselves tested. District Collector Kaushlendra Vikram Singh said the man's report returned positive on Sunday night after he had gone to a hospital on Wednesday complaining of fever.

#APFightsCorona @krishnadgoap appointed five psychologists to provide counseling for the persons on stress relief measures besides medical assistance at #Quarantine centres in the district. @xpressandhra @NewIndianXpress

details.title: Favipiravir: Much hype without any robust evidence on efficacy?
details.content: Favipiravir is manufactured by Fujifilm by the brand name Avigan and has been in use in Japan since 2014 to treat novel influenza virus and is also known to cause serious side-effects like cytotoxicity and severe birth defects if used by pregnant women.

details.title: Woman with COVID-19 delivers healthy twin girls in Karnataka, babies to be tested
details.content: Doctors wore a smile on their faces after helping a 20-year-old woman, who had tested positive for COVID-19, deliver twins at a hospital in Vijayapura. The woman who had comorbidities tested positive for the virus on Sunday. She was nine months into her pregnancy when she was brought to the designated COVID-19 hospital.

details.title: Naveen Patnaik on curtailed Rath Yatra celebrations in Puri
details.content:
• The world will be looking at us. We need to maintain discipline and social distancing and set an example for the world.
  • We have to be extremely careful during RathYatra till Niladri Bije (religious leaders carrying the idol of the Jagannath Temple deity on a procession around the temple). I
  • hope all participants who are part of the yatra obey the COVID guidelines.
  • Holding Rath Yatra during the times of COVID-19 is extremely challenging. Three ministers will be in Puri for smooth RathaYatra.
  • I thank the Supreme Court for granting permission to conduct RathaYatra.
  • I also thank the Central Government for their cooperation. Odisha Govt and Sree Jagannath Temple Administration is fully prepared to hold Rath Yatra.

details.title: 177 new cases in Punjab today
details.content: 177 fresh cases of COVID-19 and two deaths recorded in Punjab today, taking total number of cases to 4,235 including 2,825 recoveries and death toll to 101: State Health Department.

details.title: News from Punjab
details.content: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has sanctioned 300 ad-hoc posts in Medical Education Department, 100 in each in the three government-run medical colleges, to handle the critical patients: Chief Minister's Office.

details.title: News from Himachal
details.content: It has been decided to restrict the issuance of Himachal Pradesh entry e-passes. The passes will be given in case of death, medical emergency or any other unavoidable circumstances only: Kangra Deputy Commissioner

details.title: 563 new cases in Gujarat
details.content: In last 24 hours, 563 new cases of COVID-19 and 21 deaths have been reported in Gujarat. State tally rises to 27,880 including 19,917 cured/discharged and 1,685 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Assam changes its tactics against COVID-19 outbreak
details.content:
To combat #COVID19 outbreak in Guwahati, we have recommended ward wise lockdown. Wherever cases will increase rapidly total lockdown should be imposed in those wards. But this decision has to be taken by Kampur district metro: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma https://t.co/P34BmJRjeO

— ANI (@ANI) June 22, 2020

details.title: Now Gujarat to follow Odisha route to conduct Rath Yatra
details.content: Supreme Court has allowed organisation of RathYatra with certain restrictions in Odisha. Keeping this in mind, Gujarat Government has decided to file a petition in Gujarat High Court to seek permission to hold the yatra of Lord Jagannath in Ahmedabad too: Chief Minister Vijay Rupani.

details.title: Importatnt news on college examinations in Madhya Pradesh
details.content:
• First and second-year students of undergraduation courses and second-semester students of postgraduation courses to be promoted to the next year or semester on the basis of previous year's/semester's performance or internal assessment.
  • Final year/semester results of final year students of UG courses and fourth-semester students of PG courses to be declared on basis of highest marks obtained in previous years/semesters.
  • Those who want to improve their marks can opt for offline exams, dates will be announced.

details.title: No reopening of schools in Madhya Pradesh in July
details.content: Review regarding reopening of schools to be done on 31st July. Exams to be held once again for students who could not write their class 12th examinations due to any reason: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan.

details.title: Delhi chief secretary asks officials to implement all MHA directions to contain COVID-19
details.content: Sources said that in his directions to Principal Secretary (Health) Vikram Dev Dutt and Divisional Commissioner Sanjeev Khirwar, the chief secretary also asked them to ensure enhanced testing and patient-friendly medical care. (READ FULL STORY HERE)
